Sec. .316. - "PRD" Planned Residential Development District.
A.

PURPOSE AND INTENT
57/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

The purpose and intent of this section is to facilitate methods and patterns of development that will be consistent with the public
interest in the retention of the unique character of certain lands while providing for more flexible development standards and provisions
than are permitted by other residential zone districts and to encourage more creative and imaginative designs for development of
residential areas than are generally possible under conventional zoning regulations. It is further intended to promote more economical
and efficient use of the land while providing a harmonious variety of housing choices, a higher level of recreational facilities, and other
amenities, and the preservation of usable open space and natural scenic qualities of the land.
B.

CONSISTENCY WITH SPECIFIC AREA PLAN

The rezoning of any land to the "PRD" Zone district shall be approved only after the adoption of a specific area plan covering the
subject land, and shall be consistent with such adopted specific area plan. An application for a change of zone to "PRD" and the specific
area plan may be reviewed and approved as joint actions at the same public hearing.
C.

USES PERMITTED

No building or structure shall be designed, erected or structurally altered, and no building or structure or land shall be used except
in conformity with the final development plot plan approved subject to the issuance of a conditional use permit, and in conformance
with the following specific purposes only:
(Ord. No. 4096, § 14.)

1.

Residential uses
(a)

Single family units, detached on individual lot.

(b)

Single family units, attached on individual lots, including condominiums, row or townhouses.

(c)

Multiple family (rental units) attached on the same lot, including duplexes, triplexes and quadruplexes.

(d)

Multiple family (rental units) attached on the same lot in apartment complexes (5 or more units), including high-rise
structures.

(e)

Accessory structures and uses necessary and customarily incidental to the above uses.

(f)

Roominghouse, as defined in Section .062, subject to the granting of a Conditional Use Permit.

(Ord. No. 4051, § 5.)

3.

(a)

(c)

Parks and playgrounds.

(d)

Riding and hiking trails and rest areas.

(e)

Pedestrian walkways.

(f)

Swimming pools.

(g)

Community recreation buildings.

(h)

Country clubs, golf courses.

(i)

Tennis courts and clubs.

Lakes, streams and fountains.

D.

DEVELOPMENT STANDARDS
1.

Density

The maximum number of dwelling units per gross acre of land within the planned residential development project shall be
determined and governed by the adopted specific area plan covering the subject area.
2.

Minimum lot area

No minimum lot area shall be required; however, an area equal in area to any reduction in lot area below seven thousand two
hundred square feet shall be provided elsewhere within the PRD project in the form of permanent open space and/or recreational
facilities (excluding streets and parking areas).
3.

Required parking
(a)

Single family units

There shall be at least two parking spaces in a private garage, having minimum dimensions of twenty feet by twenty feet,
and two off-street, uncovered, paved parking spaces, for each single family unit. These spaces shall be on the same lot with the
structure which they are intended to serve and may be detached or attached to the dwelling structure.
(b)

Multiple family units

There shall be at least two parking spaces in an enclosed garage for each unit in a multiple family structure. These spaces
may be provided in common structures with parking spaces for several units. Each parking space shall have minimum
dimensions of ten feet by twenty feet, and shall be conveniently placed in relation to the unit they are intended to serve.
(c)

All dwelling types

There shall be at least one-fourth parking space per every dwelling unit within the planned unit development to be reserved
for the use of guest or visitor vehicle parking. These spaces shall be paved and have minimum dimensions of ten feet by twenty
feet. Visitor parking may be uncovered or covered and shall be conveniently placed on or off street but near the units they are
intended to serve.
4.

Standards of living area in each dwelling unit

The following shall be the minimum living area for PRD dwelling units:
59/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

(a)

Each attached or detached single family dwelling unit on individual lots:
(1)

Four rooms or less with a maximum of two bedrooms, one thousand one hundred
square feet;

(b)

5.

(2)

Five rooms with a maximum of three bedrooms, one thousand two hundred fifty square feet;

(3)

For every additional room over five, or bedrooms over three, an additional one hundred fifty square feet.

Each dwelling unit in duplex, triplex, quadruplex or multiple family apartment structures (all units on a common lot):
(1)

Three rooms or less with no bedrooms (bachelor apartment), five hundred square feet;

(2)

Four rooms or less with a maximum of one bedroom, seven hundred square feet;

(3)

Five rooms or less with a maximum of two bedrooms, eight hundred square feet;

(4)

For every additional room over five, or bedrooms over two, an additional one hundred fifty square feet.

Street and driveway standards

Local streets and driveways within residential developments shall be paved to at least the following minimum widths:
(a)

Streets and driveways with on-street parking permitted on both sides — minimum paved width thirty-six feet.

(b)

Streets and driveways where on-street parking will be limited to one side only — minimum twenty-eight feet.

(c)

Driveways used primarily for access to garages or carports for more than four dwelling units and with no parking
within the travel way — minimum paved width twenty-four feet.

(d)

Driveways serving four or less dwelling units, and having no parking within the travel way — minimum paved width
twenty feet.

(e)

One-way driveways shall be a minimum paved width of twelve feet, with on-street parking — the minimum width
shall be twenty feet.

(f)
6.

Structural street sections shall be in accordance with Pomona's standards street and highway plan.

The planning commission shall determine the compatibility of the proposed project with the intent and purpose of the
Hillside Ordinance (Sec. .58010) and may at its discretion modify specific provisions of the Hillside Ordinance as part of
the conditional use permit procedure for the PRD project.

recreational lands within the PRD, limiting any future use of these lands and preserving them as open space and
recreational lands.

3.

There shall be covenants, conditions and restrictions attached to and made part of all deeds conveying ownership rights
to any lot within the PRD relating to and insuring the management and maintenance of common areas, open spaces,
recreational and other facilities, including but not limited to private streets, sewers, pathways and landscaping. Such
covenants, conditions and restrictions shall provide that an assessment for the purposes of care, maintenance and
improvement of the common areas, open spaces, recreational and other facilities shall be made upon each lot within the
PRD and shall establish a method for making the claim and foreclosure including power of sale in the case of
nonpayment of the assessment which shall become a lien upon the lot.

There shall be covenants, conditions and restrictions attached to and made a part of all deeds conveying ownership

district.
The following regulations shall apply in the "A-P" administrative and professional district.

constructed for said uses, except, however, whenever buildings, designed for residential uses, have been converted entirely to
nonresidential uses permitted in the "A-P" district, such buildings may be enlarged, providing that all provisions of this ordinance
and other state and city ordinances are complied with.

M.

PROJECTION AND CLEARANCE, LENGTH AND THICKNESS OF MARQUEES
1.

Projection and clearance. The horizontal clearance between a marquee and the curb line shall be not less than two
feet. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be
less than twelve feet above the ground or pavement below. A marquee projecting less than two- thirds of the
distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be less than eight feet above tile ground or pavement
below.

2.

Length. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not
exceed twenty-five feet in length along the direction of the street.

3.

Height. The maximum height or thickness of a marquee measured vertically from its lowest to its highest point shall
not exceed three feet. No sign, light, or decoration shall be attached to or placed upon a marquee except as follows:
63/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

(a) A sign stating the name of major use of the building may be suspended below a marquee supported by such
building not more than eighteen inches, provided the sign is not less than eight feet above the grade of the sidewalk
below, and further provided that the length of the sign is erected perpendicular to the wall of the building and
projects over public property not more than six feet nor more than the projection of the marquee when the
marquee projects less than six feet over public property. Such signs shall have a maximum width of not more than
eighteen inches measured parallel with the face of the building, and such signs and marquees shall have a
combined vertical height or thickness of not more than three feet. The maximum area of any such sign shall be not
more than nine square feet.
(b)

A marquee sign, light or decoration in all cases shall be erected with a clearance of eight feet or more above
the sidewalk.

PROJECTION AND CLEARANCE, LENGTH AND THICKNESS OF MARQUEES
1.

Projection and Clearance. The horizontal clearance between a marquee and the curb line shall be not less than two
feet. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be
less than twelve feet above the ground or pavement below. A marquee projecting less than two-thirds of the
distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be less than eight feet above the ground or pavement
below.

2.

Length. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not
exceed twenty-five feet in length along the direction of the street.

3.

Height. The maximum height or thickness of a marquee measured vertically from its lowest to its highest point shall
not exceed three feet. No sign, light, or decoration shall be attached to or placed upon a marquee except as follows:
(a) A sign stating the name of major use of the building may be suspended below a marquee supported by such
building not more than eighteen inches, provided the sign is not less than eight feet above the grade of the sidewalk
below, and further provided that the length of the sign is erected perpendicular to the wall of the building and
projects over public property not more than six feet nor more than the projection of the marquee when the
marquee projects less than six feet over public property. Such signs shall have a maximum width of not more than
eighteen inches measured parallel with the face of the building, and such signs and marquees shall have a
combined vertical height or thickness of not more than three feet. The maximum area of any such sign shall be not
more than nine square feet. (b) A marquee sign, light or decoration in all cases shall be erected with a clearance of
eight feet or more above the sidewalk.

(Ord. No. 2169, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3625, § 2 (part).)

Sec. .350. - "C-2" neighborhood shopping center commercial district intent and purpose.
The "C-2" district is intended to serve as a shopping center for the convenience needs of a neighborhood area composed of a minimum
of one thousand and a maximum of twenty-five hundred families. The size of the center is proposed to be directly related to the quantity of
purchasing power available for the support of those stores that are permitted in this district. The following regulations shall apply in the "C-2"
neighborhood shopping center district.
Sec. .351. - Uses permitted.
No existing residential structure in this district may be converted to any more intensive residential use or to any other use than that
existing on the effective date of this ordinance and no such existing building shall be used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at
the same time. All sales and storage shall be conducted within a totally enclosed building constructed in conformity with the building
regulations of the city, excepting, however, that certain outdoor commercial developments such as plant nurseries and eating pavilions may
be permitted when site plans for said developments and the relationships to the total plan for the shopping district have been submitted to
and have been approved by the city planner.
No building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected, structurally altered or enlarged
except for the following purposes:

Sec. .360. - "C-3" general commercial district intent and purpose.
The "C-3" districts are intended to serve as the central trading areas of the city. The facilities provided for here as those that cannot and
should not be dispersed into the smaller, more intimate shopping areas.

Sec. .361. - Uses permitted.
An existing residential building may be converted to commercial uses or may be used partly for residential and partly for commercial
uses providing such building complies with all requirements of the department of building and safety; however, when a building is used for
residential purposes, no commercial expansion shall be permitted beyond the existing exterior walls of said building, nor may any additional
height be added to said building. When any residential building is used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at the same time, no
residential addition may be made to said building.
Any building used partially for residential and nonresidential uses shall have yards immediately surrounding the main building designed
for residential uses and shall not be used for a storage area or a place for parking of vehicles. These yards shall have the following
dimensions:

L.

PROJECTION AND CLEARANCE, LENGTH AND THICKNESS OF MARQUEES
1.

Projection and Clearance. The horizontal clearance between a marquee and the curb line shall be not less than two
feet. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be
less than twelve feet above the ground or pavement below. A marquee projecting less than two-thirds of the
distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be less than eight feet above the ground or pavement
below.

2.

Length. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not
exceed twenty-five feet in length along the direction of the street.

3.

Height. The maximum height or thickness of a marquee measured vertically from its lowest to its highest point shall
not exceed three feet. No sign, light, or decoration shall be attached to or placed upon a marquee except as follows:
(a) A sign stating the name of major use of the building may be suspended below a marquee supported by such
building not more than eighteen inches, provided the sign is not less than eight feet above the grade of the sidewalk
below, and further provided that the length of the sign is erected perpendicular to the wall of the building and
projects over public property not more than six feet nor more than the projection of the marquee when the
marquee projects less than six feet over public property. Such signs shall have a maximum width of not more than
eighteen inches measured parallel with the face of the building, and such signs and marquees shall have a
combined vertical height or thickness of not more than three feet. The maximum area of any such sign shall be not
more than nine square feet. (b) A marquee sign, light or decoration in all cases shall be erected with a clearance of
eight feet or more above the sidewalk.

(Ord. No. 2169, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3529, § 1; Ord. No. 3625, § 2 (part).)

Sec. .365. - Community shopping center commercial district intent and purpose.
The "C-C" district is intended to serve as a shopping center that provides more goods and services than a neighborhood shopping center,
but less than a regional or downtown commercial development. This district permits both soft and hard line goods affording some depth and
comparison shopping, but not to include major department stores or branches.
(Ord. No. 1962, § 1.)

Sec. .366. - Uses permitted.
No existing residential structure in this district may be converted to any more intensive residential use or to any other use than that
existing on the effective date of this ordinance, and no such existing building shall be used for both residential and non-residential purposes
at the same time. All sales and storage shall be conducted within a totally enclosed building constructed in conformity with the building
regulations of the city, excepting, however, that certain outdoor commercial developments such as plant nurseries and eating pavilions may
be permitted when site plans for said developments and the relationships to the total plan for the shopping district have been submitted to
and have been approved by the commission.
No building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected, structurally altered or enlarged
except for the following purposes:
A.

Those uses permitted in the "C-2" district.

B.

Retail stores.

YARDS.
1.

Front.
(a)

Each lot shall have a front yard extending for the full width of the lot abutting the street. Such yard shall have a
depth of not less than fifty feet, except that open canopies may have a front yard of not less than 10 feet
unless abutting a residential district or districts in which case the canopy shall have the same setback as the
most restrictive abutting residential district.

(b)

When a street is the boundary between a "C-C" district and an R-district, the open, canopy shall have the same
front yard setback as that required for the abutting residential district.

2.

Side.
(a)

For the side yards abutting the street side yard shall be the same as for the front yard.

(b)

Where the "C-C" district abuts a residential district and the boundary is not a street, there shall be a side yard
on the "C-C" lot on the side abutting the "R" district of not less than ten (10) feet.

(c)

The required side yard may be used for off-street parking or for access to off-street parking provided the walls
required in Section .503-1 are erected. In other cases said side yard shall be landscaped and maintained as a
buffer between the commercial and residential uses.

No items stored in the required side yard shall be stacked, piled or otherwise placed in such a manner as to be greater
in height than the required masonry wall.

Sec. .370. - "C-4" Highway commercial district intent and purpose.
Many uses in the commercial classification do not belong in either the neighborhood centers or the concentrated business districts.
These uses are provided for in the highway commercial district. The district may, therefore, serve many purposes, including the site for
neighborhood shops, the commercial center, and such uses as may properly belong in the city's other commercial centers.

83/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

The following regulations shall apply in the "C-4" highway commercial district.
Sec. .371. - Uses permitted.
An existing residential building may be converted to commercial uses or may be used partly for residential and partly for commercial
uses providing such building complies with all requirements of the department of building and safety; however, when a building is used for
residential purposes, no commercial expansion shall be permitted beyond the existing walls of said building, nor shall any additional height
be added to said building.
When any residential building is used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at the same time, no residential addition may be
made to said building.
In any building used partially for residential and nonresidential uses, no areas required for front, rear and side yards shall be used as a
storage area or a place for parking of vehicles.
Except as provided above, no building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected,
structurally altered, or enlarged except for the following purposes:

permitted beyond the existing walls of said building, nor shall any additional height be added to said building.
When any residential building is used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at the same time, no residential addition may be
made to said building.
In any building used partially for residential and nonresidential purposes uses, no areas required for front, rear and side yards shall be
used as a storage area or a place for parking of vehicles.
(Ord. No. 3581, § 3 (part).)

Sec. .373. - Property development standards.
The following property development standards shall apply to all land and/or structures in the "C-4" district.
A.

LOT AREA.

No requirement.
B.

LOT DIMENSIONS.
1.

Width:

No requirements.
2.

Depth:

Minimum depth, one hundred fifty feet.
C.

POPULATION DENSITY.
1.

D.

No dwellings permitted in this district, except as provided for in Section .371.

Yards.
1.

Commercial:

None required other than when a "C-4" district abuts a residential district.
Where a "C-4" district abuts a residential district the following yards shall be required.
(a)

Front yard:

There shall be a front yard for the full width of the lot or for the first fifty feet of frontage of the "C-4" lot adjacent to a
residential district. Said front yard shall be the same as that required for the abutting residential district.
(b)

Side yard:
86/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

There shall be a side yard of not less than ten feet on that side of the lot in the "C-4" district that abuts a residential
district. Said side yard may be used for parking or for access to parking as per Section. .503-H.
(c)

Rear yard:

Where a "C-4" district rears or sides upon a street which is the boundary between a "C-4" district and a residential
district, there shall be a six foot high masonry wall on the rear or side of the "C-4" property, said wall to be set back not less
than ten feet from the property line. The space between the property line and the wall shall be planted and maintained.
2.

Residential:

Yards shall be maintained for residential buildings even though said buildings and/or lots are used for residential and
nonresidential uses at the same time. Yard requirements shall be based on those minimum standards which first appear in this
zoning ordinance, e.g.: "R-1" district yard areas shall be required for single-family dwellings, "R-2" district yard areas shall be
required for two-family dwellings, etc. In no cases shall required yard areas stated above be used for nonresidential off-street
parking or open storage.
E.

COVERAGE

Same as "C-3"; provided, however, that the yard provisions of Section .373-D shall apply where abutting all residential districts.
F.

BUILDING HEIGHT

No building or structure erected in this district shall have a height greater than six stories or seventy-five feet. For roof structures
and hillside property exceptions, see Section .503-F.
G.

MINIMUM DISTANCE BETWEEN BUILDINGS

No requirements, except when a residency is located on a lot: See yards.

PROJECTION AND CLEARANCE, LENGTH AND THICKNESS OF MARQUEES
(1)

Projection and clearance. The horizontal clearance between a marquee and the curb line shall be not less than two
feet. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be
less than twelve feet above the ground or pavement below. A marquee projecting less than two-thirds of the
distance from the property line to the curb line shall not be less than eight feet above the ground or pavement
below.

(2)

Length. A marquee projecting more than two-thirds of the distance from the property line to the curb line shall not
exceed twenty-five feet in length along the direction of the street.

(3)

Height. The maximum height or thickness of a marquee measured vertically from its lowest to its highest point shall
not exceed three feet. No sign, light, or decoration shall be attached to or placed upon a marquee except as follows:
(a) A sign stating the name of major use of the building may be suspended below a marquee supported by such
87/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

building not more than eighteen inches, provided the sign is not less than eight feet above the grade of the sidewalk
below, and further provided that the length of the sign is erected perpendicular to the wall of the building and
projects over public property not more than six feet nor more than the projection of the marquee when the
marquee projects less than six feet over public property. Such signs shall have a maximum width of not more than
eighteen inches measured parallel with the face of the building, and such signs and marquees shall have a
combined vertical height or thickness of not more than three feet. The maximum area of any such sign shall be not
more than nine square feet. (b) A marquee sign, light or decoration in all cases shall be erected with a clearance of
eight feet or more above the sidewalk.
(Ord. No. 2169, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3625, § 2 (part).)

distributing and storage. And to provide a close relationship between warehousing, distribution and retail sales.

building regulations of the city.

except for the following purposes:

Sec. .395. - "M" Special industrial zone.
This zone is intended to provide for and encourage the development of light industrial uses, laboratories, research and development
plants, and administrative office buildings and their related facilities.
91/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

(Ord. No. 2788 § 2 (part).)

Sec. .396. - Permitted buildings, structures and uses.
The following buildings, structures and uses, either singly or in combination, are permitted in the "M" zone. The following uses, except
the raising of agricultural crop, shall be conducted within a totally enclosed building, except as herein otherwise provided:
(a)

Light manufacturing, research, assembly, testing and repair of components, devices, equipment and systems, and parts
and components, such as, but not limited to:

Electronic, guidance or radio systems.
Coils, tubes, semi-conductors.
Communication guidance and control systems.
Data processing.
Metering instruments.
Optical devices equipment and systems.
Phonographs and audio units.
Radar, infra-red and ultra-violet equipment and systems.
Scientific and mechanical instruments.
Television and radio equipment.
Testing equipment.
Graphic arts equipment.
Photographic equipment.
(b)

Light manufacturing, including:
1.

Assembly, compounding, fabricating, packaging, processing, or treating of articles or merchandise, such as, but not
limited to:

Baked goods.
Candy.
Cosmetics.
Drugs.
Electrical products.
Fluorescent products.
Garments.
Perfume.
Toiletries.
Toys.

Assembly, compounding, fabricating, packaging, processing, or treating of articles or merchandise from previously
prepared materials, such as, but not limited to:

Cellophane.

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

facilities, such as, but not limited to:

Biochemical.
Film.
Medical or dental.
Metallurgy.
Physical and chemical.
X-ray.
Pharmaceuticals.

General warehousing where all storage of merchandise, materials or equipment is within a totally enclosed building. The

Rubber products fabrication from finished rubber.

Regional or home offices of industries and public utilities.

Blueprinting, photostating, photo engraving.

Printing, publishing of books, periodicals and newspapers and book-binding.

STANDARDS OF OPERATION
(1)

No portion of any lot or parcel shall be used in such a way as to create a nuisance to adjacent sites, such as, but not
limited to, vibration, sound, electro-mechanical disturbance and radiation, electro-magnetic disturbance, radiation,
air or water pollution, dust, emission of odorous, toxic or noxious matter.

The applicant should be aware that his proposed operation shall have adequate controls, measures, or devices provided to
insure and protect against the emission of odor, dust, gas, smoke, noise, fumes, vibrations, or heat beyond the exterior limits of
the premises.
(2)
(n)

All lighting is to be shielded and confined within property lines.

STORAGE

All outdoor storage of materials, supplies, or projects, as an accessory use to the primary use, shall be enclosed by a solid
concrete or masonry wall, having a minimum height of six feet. All general warehousing uses shall be conducted within a totally
enclosed building.
(o)

BUILDING PROVISIONS
(1)

The exterior walls of all buildings shall be constructed of a minimum of two skins at least one inch from the exterior
surface of the exterior skin to the exterior surface of the interior skin or of masonry block, brick, reinforced
concrete, or tilt-up concrete slab construction.

(2)

No building or structure of any kind or type shall be moved into the "M" zone, nor shall any portable building be
permitted to be placed in this zone, except when used in constructing a building.

(p)

TELEPHONE AND ELECTRICAL SERVICES

All utility services shall be placed underground in a manner as prescribed by the department of public works.

Secs. .402 to .406. - Repealed by Ordinance No. 3717.
Sec. .410. - "M-1" Light industrial district intent and purpose.
The light industrial district ("M-1") is intended to provide for the development of industrial uses which include fabrication, manufacturing,
assembly or processing of materials that are in a processed form and which do not in their maintenance, assembly, manufacture or plant
operation create smoke, gas, odor, dust, sound, vibration, soot or lighting to any degree which might be termed obnoxious or offensive to
persons residing in or conducting business in either this or any other zoning district of the city.
The following regulations shall apply in the "M-l" light industrial district.
Sec. .411. - Uses permitted.
No existing residential structure in this district may be converted to any more intensive residential use or to any other use than that
existing on the effective date of this ordinance and no such existing building shall be used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at
the same time.
All manufacturing operations shall be conducted within a totally enclosed building constructed in conformity with the building
regulations of the city.
No building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected, structurally altered or enlarged
except for the following purposes:

Kennels, provided that such operations shall comply with the following standards:
a.

A conditional use permit is granted pursuant to Section .580 of this ordinance.

b.

Between the hours of ten p.m. and seven a.m. the operation shall be conducted within a totally enclosed
building.

c.

97/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

d.

All open run areas shall be screened from abutting properties with a buffer strip of landscaping materials or a
six foot high solid fence where deemed necessary by the planning commission at the time of consideration of
the conditional use permit.

A conditional use permit granted to permit a kennel may be revoked by the council if it is found that any of the terms of the
conditional use permit have been violated. Any person who alleges that the terms of such conditional use permit have been
violated may initiate hearings before the commission and the council to determine whether or not the terms of the conditional
use permit have been violated and therefore should be revoked. The procedure provided for this shall be as follows:
1.

Upon receipt of the verified complaint, the commission shall fix a time and place of public hearing
thereon which shall not be less than fifteen days nor more than forty days thereafter.

2.

The commission shall hold one public hearing upon the matter, shall hear all evidence presented by both
the complainant and the owner, and shall report its recommendations to the council.

3.

The council, after receipt of the commission's report and recommendation, may hear the evidence of
both the complainant and the owner and may either approve or reject the report and findings of the
commission, and, thereafter, may either grant the complainant's request and revoke the conditional use
permit for a kennel, deny the complainant's request and leave the conditional use permit for a kennel in
full force and effect, or may grant to the owner a period of time not to exceed thirty days to correct any
violation of the terms of the conditional use permit if it is found that any violations exist. If the latter
course is followed and additional time is granted to the owner to correct any violations, and the
complainant or any other complainant reports that violations upon such premises still exist after the
time limit specified by order of the council, such complainant may file a verified complaint with the city
clerk without paying any filing fee, and the council may at its next meeting make an order for the owner
to show cause why the conditional use permit for the kennel should not be revoked. If the owner cannot
thereafter at any time designated by the council present satisfactory evidence to the council showing
good and valid reason why such conditional use permit should not be revoked, the council may revoke
such permit without any further notice.

Notices shall be given of the time and place of all hearings which shall be held pursuant to the provisions of this subsection
by the planning director to the owner and current business licensee of such kennel, as shown on the records of the city clerk,
and to the complainant, at least ten days prior to the date for which hearing is to be held. Such notices shall be by certified mail
and shall be deemed given when deposited in a United States Post Office box, postage prepaid, in an envelope addressed to the
owner and to the current business licensee as shown on the records of the city clerk, and to the complainant at the address
shown, respectively, for each upon the application for the conditional use permit and the complaint, or any other address which
either the owner or the complainant have filed in writing with the planning department to which notices may be sent. In addition
to the above notices, the owner and current business licensee as shown in the records of the office of the city clerk, shall also be
notified of the commencement of such proceedings by posting the subject property with a notice upon a card at least one
square foot in area with a heading of letters at least one-half inch high, which shall provide "NOTICE OF COMMENCEMENT OF
PROCEEDINGS TO DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT THE CONDITIONAL USE PERMIT FOR A KENNEL FOR THIS PROPERTY SHOULD
BE REVOKED." Such notice shall also state the name of the complainant, the nature of the violations complained of, the day, time
and place at which the hearing will be held by the commission concerning the matter.

FOUNDRY OPERATIONS, using specified types of furnaces and fulfilling all of the following standards of operation for
furnaces and related operations listed below:
1.

All such foundry operations described herein shall be an incidental use to uses allowed in the M-1, light industrial
district. Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to allow related uses to said foundry operations, such as
forging or drop hammer operations, but only such types of related operations as are specified in the subsection
below.

2.

All furnaces used in connection with foundry operations shall consist of one or more of the following types, but
shall not comprise more than a total of three in number; provided, that a maximum number of two such furnaces
shall be in operation at any one time: Gas fired reverberatory, gas fired crucible, or electric induction melting. Each
furnace described shall have a maximum melting capacity not to exceed one thousand pounds.

3.

All furnaces shall be subject to the performance standards and regulations established as of this date or in the
future, by the Los Angeles County air pollution control district.

4.

Refined or ingot metals only shall be used in the operation of said furnaces. Only rejected or imperfect castings,
gates and risers shall be reused. The melting, alloying, refining and reclaiming with contaminated scrap metals shall

YARDS:
1.

Front yard:
102/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

There shall be a front yard of not less than twenty-five feet.
(Ord. No. 3385. § 24.)

2.

Side yard:

None required, except when abutting a residential district (other than an R-l district, in which case, see Section .413-D-4.
below) when a minimum side yard of twenty percent of the width of the lot shall be required. However, said yard shall not be
less than ten feet, but need not exceed fifty feet. Said yard may be used for off-street parking or the open storage of materials
provided the wall requirements as stated in Section .503-1 are complied with.
3.

Rear yard:

None required, except when abutting a residential district (other than an R-l district, in which case, see Section .413-D-4,
below), when a minimum rear yard of twenty percent of the depth of the lot shall be required. However, said yard shall not be
less than ten feet, but need not exceed fifty feet. Said yard may be used for off-street parking or the open storage of materials
provided the wall requirements as stated in Section .503-1 are complied with.
(Ord. No. 1569, § 1.)

4.

Yards required when adjacent to an "R-1" district.

Whenever a lot or parcel of land in the "M-l" district abuts a lot or parcel of land in an "R-l" district or abuts any street or
alley which separates an "M-1" district from any "R-l" district, there shall be a required building setback of sixty feet from such
residential lot, parcel of land, street or alley; furthermore, except when a residential lot, parcel of land, street or alley backs to
said "M-l" district, a yard, appropriately landscaped with plant material and maintained, shall be required adjacent to such
residential lot or parcel of land or street within the area of setback required above; such yard shall have a uniform depth of a
minimum of twenty feet. The remaining area of building setback may be used for automobile parking or for the open storage of
materials, provided a solid masonry wall is erected along the boundary of the area of landscaping, located a minimum distance
of twenty feet from the aforementioned residential lot or parcel of land or street; said wall shall have a height of two and onehalf feet when such area is used for automobile parking, or a height of six feet when such area is used for the open storage of
materials: providing, however, in the latter case, no materials shall be stored higher than such six-foot high solid masonry wall.
No wall shall be required in the abovementioned area of setback unless such area of setback is used for automobile parking or
for the open storage of materials; and providing further, that the entire sixty feet of building setback is landscaped with plant
material and maintained.
When a lot or parcel of land in the "R-l" district backs to or is separated by an alley from a lot or parcel of land in the "M-l"
district, an area of landscaping shall not be required; however, a six-foot high solid masonry wall shall be constructed along the
property line separating the "R-l" district from the "M-l" district or along the alley right of way line on the "M-1" side of said alley:
materials may not be stored higher than said six-foot high wall. In addition to the requirements stated above, a building setback
of one hundred feet shall be required from the south boundary of Harrison Avenue, between Garey Avenue and the westerly
boundary of the "M-l" district, between Harrison Avenue and Bonita Avenue.
5.

Landscaped setbacks along certain streets: (a) Further, in addition to the requirements stated above, a minimum
building setback of twenty feet shall be required in the M-l zoning district from the western Pomona city limits
boundary to Garey Avenue along the south side of Bonita Avenue, and such setback shall be appropriately
landscaped with plant material and shall be maintained by the person who is occupying the premises, or in the
event of his failure, the owner of the property after buildings have been erected upon said land or when the
property is otherwise developed. (b) A further minimum landscaped setback of fifteen feet shall also be required in
the M-l zoning district from Franklin Avenue to Philadelphia Street along the east side of Reservoir Street, and such
setback shall also be appropriately landscaped with plant material and shall be maintained by the person who is
occupying the premises, or in the event of his failure, the owner of the property, after buildings have been erected
upon said land or when the property is otherwise developed, and a six-foot high solid masonry wall shall be erected
along the interior line of the landscaped setback area whenever said landscaped setback area abuts an area which
is used for open storage. A minimum fifty-seven-inch high solid masonry wall shall be erected along the interior line

103/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

of the landscaped setback area, whenever said landscaped setback area abuts an area which is used for off-street
parking facilities. No wall shall be required if all the area between the street right-of-way and the building is
landscaped and maintained as provided above.

Sec. .420. - "M-2" general industrial district intent and purpose.
The "M-2" general industrial district is intended to provide for the establishment of certain industrial uses considered by the council to be
essential to the development of a balanced economic base for the city.
The following regulations shall apply in the "M-2" general industrial district.
Sec. .421. - Uses permitted.
No existing residential structure in this district may be converted to any more intensive residential use or to any other use than that
existing on the effective date of this ordinance and no such existing building shall be used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at
the same time.
All manufacturing operations shall be conducted within a totally enclosed building constructed in conformity with the building
regulations of the city.
No building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected, structurally altered or enlarged
except for the following purposes:
A.

Uses permitted in the "M-1" light manufacturing district.
1.

Adult-Oriented Business (Subject to the development standards set forth in Section .5809-5 and Chapter 14.5 of the
Pomona City Code, Ordinance No. 3873).

(Ord. No. 3913, § 2.)

B.

Other manufacturing uses may be permitted in this zoning district subject to obtaining a conditional use permit from the
planning commission, after a full and complete description of the processes of industrial operation is made. The decision
of the planning commission shall be final unless a notice of appeal is filed pursuant to Section .560G1.

(Ord. No. 3223, § 1 (part).)

C.

Where any doubt or uncertainty exists as to the proper zoning district classification of an industrial use, the planning
commission shall determine such, based on the following conditions:
1.

That field investigations have disclosed that the subject use and its operation are compatible with the uses
permitted in the area wherein it is proposed to be located; and

2.

That the subject use is similar to one or more uses permitted in the district within which it is proposed to be
located; and

3.

That the subject use will not cause substantial injury to the values of property in the neighborhood within which it is
proposed to be located; and

4.

That the subject use will be so designed, located and operated that the public health, safety and general welfare will
be protected. The decision of the planning commission shall be final unless a notice of appeal is filed pursuant to
Section .560G1.

(Ord. No. 3223, § 1 (part).)

E.

RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS, LIMITED USE.

Upon receiving a conditional use permit from the city council, one dwelling designed to be used or used in connection with any
industrial establishment may be erected. Such dwelling shall be occupied by the owner or lessee of such industrial establishment
and his family, or an employee of such owner or lessee, and his family, subject to any requirements or restrictions necessary for
public health, safety and welfare. Minor alterations and expansions may be permitted on existing residential buildings.
An existing one family dwelling in this district may be enlarged; see Section 554-E. No existing residential structure in this district
may be converted to any more intensive residential use or to any other use than that existing on the effective date of this ordinance
and no such existing building shall be used for both residential and nonresidential purposes at the same time.
(Ord. No. 3581, § 3 (part).)

Sec. .435. - "F" the fairgrounds zoning district intent and purpose.
The fairgrounds zoning district is intended to provide for the use of the public fairgrounds in a manner so as to not create smoke, gas,
odor, dust, sound, vibration, soot or lighting or other nuisance in any degree which might be termed obnoxious or offensive to persons
residing in or near the Fairplex and is intended to allow a range of public entertainment, exhibition, commercial, conference, equine, and
other events and uses on a year-round basis as previously permitted by Ordinance No. 2450. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, the
uses, structures and events permitted and conditionally permitted in the F zoning district are subject to the application of all applicable city
building permit and grading permit review, and that no temporary use permit shall be required for permitted uses under Section .436 hereof.
The City's design review process shall apply to conditionally permitted uses under Section .437 hereof.
(Ord. No. 4012, § 3 (part).)

Sec. .444. - Industrial/commercial overlay district.
A.

Purpose. The industrial/commercial overlay district is established to provide for:
1.

Conditionally permitted development of commercial uses within an industrial zone area, incidental and not detrimental
to the M-1 (light industrial) zone.

B.

2.

To allow industrial properties with freeway visibility and access to be used for regional commercial purposes.

3.

To foster reuse of abandoned or underutilized industrial buildings.

4.

To allow commercial uses that service industrial areas within M-1 zoned properties along an arterial roadway.

Definitions.

Shopping Mall—A retail center with multiple retail units with public entrances from a common area.
C.

Application. The industrial/commercial overlay district may be applied to all M-1 (light industrial) and M (special industrial)
zoned properties located within specific locations depending on the type of commercial uses proposed. The sites adjacent to
State Route 71 will be allowed to have regional commercial uses. Areas within the M-1 and M zones that are located on an
arterial roadway may have commercial uses that provide services to employees and visitors of those areas.

The provisions of this section take precedence over the regulations of the M-1 and M districts in which the property is classified.
D.

E.

Findings. Approval of the application of the overlay zone is subject to the following findings:
1.

Conformance with the general plan;

2.

The proposed uses will be compatible with surrounding industrial uses;

3.

For regional commercial uses, the project must have access to a freeway;

4.

For commercial serving industrial uses, the project must have access to an arterial roadway.

Permitted and Conditionally Permitted Uses. All new projects within a commercial/industrial overlay zone area require
approval of a conditional use permit. The following table list uses requiring a conditional use permit for specific consideration

Sec. .450. - (Civic) Civic supplementary use district intent and purpose.
This district is intended to provide for the orderly and harmonious development of properties adjacent to or in the immediate vicinity of
the Civic Center or other public or quasi-public properties by setting forth property development standards and use restrictions in addition to
those specified in the zone district to which this "Civic" supplemental use district has been added.
(Ord. No. 1990, § 1; Ord. No. 2077, § 1.)

Sec. .451. - Uses permitted.
No building or structure shall be erected or enlarged except for any use permitted which does not intensify the legally existing use of
land in the zone to which the "Civic" supplemental use district is added and providing that a conditional use permit is first obtained,
according to the procedure of Section .580-C, except that in all residential zones one single family house per lot is permitted and in all
nonresidential zones a one thousand (1,000) square foot office building is permitted on each lot without the required conditional use permit.
Notwithstanding the above, all the other property development standards of the civic supplemental use district and the zone district to which
the civic district has been added must be met.
(Ord. No. 3636, § 4.)

and the following:

Sale and display of used or second hand merchandise unless in a totally enclosed building.

(Ord. No. 1990, § 1.)

d.

Mobile homes/manufactured homes shall not be permitted as an addition to any site-built structure.

Sec. .470. - Redevelopment supplementary use district intent and purpose.
The express intent of this zoning district is to facilitate specific developments within a redevelopment project area in conformance with
the goals and policies established by the redevelopment plan as approved and adopted by the city. In that a full review and analysis of the
particular redevelopment plan is an integral part of the redevelopment process, the approved plan shall be deemed to control the focus and
development standards applied to each particular project within the redevelopment supplementary use zone. Inherent in this is the
application of project-specific development standards so that the adopted intent of the redevelopment plan may be realized.
(Ord. No. 2521, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3266, § 1 (part).)

Sec. .471. - Application of redevelopment supplementary use district.
Through the amendment to the zoning text procedure (Section .5-70) the city council, upon recommendation of the planning commission
and the redevelopment agency, may establish the "Redevelopment Supplementary Use District Overlay" to any land within any
redevelopment project area. This supplemental use district shall be applied on a development-specific basis and not applied indiscriminately
to an entire project area, unless a review of the entire project area determines that such entire coverage will be of benefit to achieving the
goals of the project area.
(Ord. No. 2521, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3266, § 1 (part).)

Pomona, CA Zoning

A.

B.

authority of this zoning district, unless other applicable zoning overlay districts, such as the Highrise Zone are proposed to be applied to

with the R-4 development standards.
When the proposed project fails to satisfy development standards set forth in the R-4 zoning district, the noncompliance shall be
reviewed against the intent and focus of the project as established by the redevelopment plan. Upon satisfactory demonstration that the
noncomplying development factor will not be injurious to the health, safety and welfare of the city, and that such a standard is in
compliance with the redevelopment plan, the noncomplying standard shall be adopted as the controlling standard for the specific
project proposed.
(Ord. No. 2521, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3266, § 1 (part).)

Sec. .474. - Repealed by Ordinance No. 3266.
Sec. .480. - Residential-Manufactured Housing Development Zone (R-MHD).
There is hereby created a Residential-Manufactured Housing Development Zone, (R-MHD). This zone may be applied to those areas
designated by the General Plan for residential uses and shall further be consistent with the density limitations of the various General Plan
residential categories.
If the R-MHD Zone is to be applied to any undeveloped property it shall be effective for one year. After such time the zoning shall revert
back to the zone from which it was changed, with the exception that one year extensions may be granted after review by the Planning
Commission and approval of the City Council.
The property development standards contained in Subsection .483 shall apply to all Manufactured Housing Developments established
after the date of adoption of this ordinance.
Any manufactured housing development established and in use prior to the date of adoption of this ordinance shall be allowed to
continue with NON-CONFORMING USE RIGHTS being applied to the standards contained in Sections .481, .482, and .483. Any expansion,
addition, or renovation shall be subject to all the applicable standards in Sections .481, .482, and .483.
Section .484 Noticing Requirements, Section .485 Impact Report, .486 Relocation Plan, and .487 Notice of Public Hearing shall in
accordance with state law apply to all manufactured housing developments in existence regardless to their time of establishment.
(Ord. No. 3137, § 1 (part).)

114/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

Sec. .481. - Intent and purpose.
The regulations as set forth in this section are intended to provide for the orderly development of manufactured housing developments
and to provide for their harmonious relationship with properties in the immediate vicinity. The standards contained in this section are set
forth to be the minimum. Upon reviewing an application for establishing or enlarging a manufactured housing development the Planning
Commission may establish conditions or requirements in addition to or in excess of, those minimum requirements set forth in this ordinance
when such additional requirements are deemed to be in the public welfare and interest.
(Ord. No. 3137, § 1 (part).)

Sec. .482. - Uses permitted.
No building or structure or land shall be used, and no building or structure shall be designed, erected, structurally altered or enlarged
except for the following purposes:
A.

MANUFACTURED HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS SUBJECT TO OBTAINING A CONDITIONAL USE PERMIT.

B.

MANUFACTURED HOUSING UNIT SALES—The sales of manufactured housing units for the purpose of locating those
units in the manufactured housing development, provided a business license is first obtained from the office of the City
Clerk.

C.

Group care facilities subject to the provisions of Section .5809-14

D.

And such other uses as the Planning Manager may determine to be similar and which are not specifically listed in a less
restrictive zoning district. The decision of the Planning Manager shall be final unless a notice of appeal is filed pursuant
to Section .501-A.

(Ord. No. 3137, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3223, § 1 (part); Ord. No. 3713, § 4; Ord. No. 3971, § 16.)

Sec. .482.5. - Uses expressly prohibited.
A.

Medical marijuana dispensaries.

(Ord. No. 4096, § 27.)

Sec. .483. - Property development standards.
Manufactured housing shall be in accordance with the following minimum standards:
A.

LOCATION—When considering the approval of a manufactured housing development site based on its general impact on
the immediate vicinity and terrain, the Planning Commission shall consider the following criteria:
1.

Hillside Areas. Sites that present excessive exposure of convention metal exteriorated manufactured housing units
due to hillside locations when viewed from lower elevations or sites near the base of developable hillside areas
where the view is from above, shall not be considered suitable for manufactured housing development and may be
denied for this reason by the Planning Commission. However, manufactured housing units utilizing an exterior
finishing treatment as specified in Sec. .229.3-M-4, and of which the design is approved by the Planning
Commission, will be considered when in the opinion of the Planning Commission the visual effect will not be
substantially different from conventional residential development.

2.

Views. Views and vistas that are of community-wide benefit shall not be obstructed or dominated by a
manufactured housing development.

3.

Landscaping. Whenever the Planning Commission approves a manufactured housing development as described in
1 and 2, the Planning Commission may require additional trees and other screening type landscape.

B.

MINIMUM DEVELOPMENT AREA—Manufactured Housing Developments shall be developed on a parcel of land not less
than fifteen (15) acres in area.

C.

SITE SETBACKS—The setback from the manufactured housing development property lines shall be as follows:
1.

Front Yard. For all manufactured housing developments having street frontage, the setback along all street
frontages shall be the front yard requirement of the zone in which it is situated, but in no case less than fifteen (15)
115/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

feet. However, if the park is adjacent to a residential district with a more restrictive front yard, the park shall follow
the setback of the adjacent zoning district.
2.

Interior Property Lines. A ten (10) foot yard setback is required where an interior property line abuts the
manufactured housing development from single family residences or zoning districts (except when use is a flood
control channel or a railroad or freeway right-of-way). When the manufactured housing development abuts other
than single family zoning districts, no setback is required.

3.

Encroachment. In no case shall any structure other than a permitted fence or wall be located within any interior
property line setback area.

D.

PERIMETER WALLS—Along all interior property boundary lines a six (6) foot high solid decorative masonry wall shall be
erected and maintained, but shall not extend into required street frontage yards. To the rear of all street frontage yard
setbacks a six foot high solid decorative masonry wall shall be erected and maintained. Approved entry roadway or
walkway openings into said development are permitted as an exception to the above. When an existing six (6) foot high
solid masonry wall or building exists on the subject property line or street frontage setback lines, the Planning
Commission may accept these walls in place of those required above.

E.

LANDSCAPING REQUIREMENTS
1.

Setbacks. All required development setback areas shall be permanently landscaped and maintained with ground
cover, trees, and shrubs. The landscape areas shall be irrigated and planted to the approval of the city planner.

2.

Street Trees. Permanent landscaping, including ground cover, shrubs, trees and irrigation shall be provided along
the roadways and throughout the development to create a desirable effect as well as sufficient shade and screen.
The trees shall be planted and irrigated by the developer as approved by the city planner.

3.

Living Unit Lots. All open areas on individual living unit lots shall be landscaped and maintained by the unit owner
unless otherwise specified.

4.

Open Space. All required open space areas shall be permanently landscaped and maintained with ground cover,
trees and shrubs. The landscaped areas shall be irrigated and planted to the approval of the City Planner.

5.

Minimum Tree Size. All trees used for landscaping shall be at least fifteen (15) gallon size trees.

6.

Landscaping Plan Approval. Prior to issuance of a building permit the Building Division shall ascertain that
landscaping plans have been submitted to, and approved by, the City Planner.

7.

Maintenance. Any failure to maintain the required landscaped areas per the approved plan shall be, and the same
is hereby declared to be, unlawful and a public nuisance endangering the health, safety and general welfare of the
public and a detriment to the surrounding community. The manufactured housing development owner shall be
responsible for all areas, with the exception of the areas contained on each individual living unit lot. The
maintenance of each living unit lot shall be the responsibility of the occupant of the living unit.

F.

ACCESS REQUIREMENTS—There shall be provided at least two vehicular access points to all manufactured housing
developments. One access shall be designated as permanent; the other may be for emergency only, if so approved by
the Planning Commission. The permanent access shall be required to connect directly with a major or secondary
highway, or connect on a local street at a point within three hundred (300) feet of an intersection with such local street
and a major or secondary highway, if approved by the City Traffic Engineer. A major or secondary highway is a street as
set forth on the Master Plan of Principal Streets and Highways Map.

G.

RECREATION AND OPEN SPACE AREAS - Manufactured Housing Developments shall have certain areas set aside for recreation
and open space. "Open space" is defined as space such as recreational areas, park yard setback, walkways, and landscaped
areas available to all residents of the manufactured housing development. Areas used for streets, lot yards, storage, parking,
laundry and trash receptacles shall not be considered as open space. Recreation and open space shall be provided as follows:
1.

Adult Standards. In an adult only manufactured housing development, or in the adult section of a manufactured
housing development, five hundred (500) square feet per individual lot shall be set aside for recreation and open
space. A minimum of two hundred (200) square feet of each five hundred (500) square feet is to be used exclusively
for recreation.

2.

Family Standards. In a family manufactured housing development, or in the family section of a manufactured
116/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

housing development, eight hundred (800) square feet per individual lot shall be set aside for recreation and open
space. A minimum of five hundred (500) square feet of each eight hundred (800) square feet to be used exclusively
for recreation.
3.

Adult/Family Standards. Developments that combine family and adult sections shall provide separate recreation
areas for each section based on their respective formula.

4.

Location. Recreation areas shall be designed to have a usable shape and shall have at least one-half (½) of their
periphery on a manufactured housing development roadway frontage.

5.
H.

Recreation Facilities. Recreation facilities shall include recreation equipment suitable for the needs of the residents.

INTERIOR ROADWAYS
1.

Design. Roadways shall be designed so that each living unit lot shall front upon a roadway within the development,
and provide convenient and reasonable traffic circulation. The Planning Commission shall approve or disapprove
the design of such roadway pattern.

2.

Standards. All roadways shall have a required minimum width of thirty (30) feet. If parallel parking is to be
permitted, the street shall be widened three (3) feet on each side where parking occurs. Where parking occurs a
four (4) foot wide sidewalk shall be installed. All roadways shall be graded and surfaced their entire width to the
structural standards for a local residential street as approved by the City Engineer. Adequate street drainage shall
be provided to the approval of the City Engineer.

3.

Parking Prohibited. Roadways within a manufactured housing development shall not be used for automobile
parking at any time, unless designed to accommodate auto parking and pedestrian traffic.

4.

Street Improvements. The interior roadways shall be improved as follows: curbs, gutters, street lighting on
ornamental standards, and landscaping.

I.

INTERNAL LIGHTING—The premises shall be adequately lighted by lights as follows:
1.

2.

Location.
a.

Along interior roads and their intersections;

b.

At all guest parking areas;

c.

Within all recreation areas;

d.

At all trash depots;

e.

Around all buildings containing public facilities;

f.

Along all interior walkways.

Light Intensity. The general area or tract of land containing the manufactured housing development shall be lighted
to provide an average of .25 average horizontal foot candles throughout the development.

3.

Light Standard Height. Freestanding lighting shall be in keeping with the residential character and shall not exceed a
height of twelve (12) feet.

J.

GUEST PARKING—In addition to the automobile parking area on the living unit lot, there shall be established and
maintained within each manufactured housing development well distributed parking areas for guests. The minimum
number of such parking spaces within the development shall be equal to one (1) for every two (2) living unit lots, or
fraction thereof, within the development.

K.

WALKWAYS—Sufficient walkways shall be provided to insure the convenient and safe movement of pedestrian traffic
throughout the development. Walkways serving utility buildings, recreational areas and other general areas shall be a
minimum of four (4) feet in width. Walkways must be surfaced to the satisfaction of the City Engineer.

L.

UTILITIES—Each living unit's lot shall be provided with underground facilities for sanitary sewers, water, telephone and
electric service and provisions for making connections thereto. All water and sanitary sewer services shall be subject to
use and installation standards of the City of Pomona. Fire hydrants shall be installed in conjunction with the utilities per
the requirements of both the Pomona Fire Department and the Pomona Water Department.

M.

T.V. ANTENNAE—Individual television antennae shall be prohibited. A single central television tower is permitted
provided said tower does not exceed the height limitation of the zoning district in which the development is located. Said
tower shall serve every living unit lot through underground cable.
117/322

7/11/2019

Pomona, CA Zoning

N.

STORAGE—A minimum of one and five-tenths (1.5) percent of the gross manufactured housing development's total area sha
for storage of travel trailers. Such area shall be paved to the satisfaction of the City Planner and enclosed by a six (6) foot hig
decorative masonry wall with a solid gate. The required storage shall be in addition to that required for vehicular parking or
Said area shall be lighted adequately, provided with yard drains for adequate drainage, and shall have electrical outlets and
located in such manner to provide convenient access.

O.

STRUCTURE HEIGHT—No building or structure shall exceed one (1) story or twenty (20) feet in height.

P.

TRASH COLLECTION DEPOT—One (1) trash collection depot to contain a minimum of one (1) three (3) cubic yard trash bin
for every ten (10) living unit lots is required. All such areas shall be situated adjacent to interior roadways in such manner
as to provide convenient use by all park occupants and easy receptacle removal by the refuse collector. All trash depots
shall be screened on three (3) sides by a five (5) foot high masonry wall and screened from public view by a solid gate.
Each trash depot shall be lighted adequately and shall have a hose bibb located within the depot.

Q.

PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEMS—Public address systems or loudspeakers shall not be permitted if audible outside the
boundaries of the manufactured housing unit development.

R.

DENSITY—Maximum density for a manufactured housing development shall not exceed ten (10) lots per net acre.

S.

MANUFACTURED HOUSING LOT DIMENSIONS
1.

Minimum lot area: three thousand seven hundred fifty (3,750) square feet;

2.

Minimum lot width: fifty (50) feet;

3.

Minimum lot depth for all units: seventy-five (75) feet;

4.

Optional Lot Dimension—up to twenty-five (25) percent of the total number of living unit lots may be designed to
accommodate single wide manufactured housing units. The minimum lot width to accommodate single wide
manufactured living units shall be thirty- five (35) feet.

T.

LIVING UNIT LOT YARDS
1.

Front. Each living unit lot shall have a minimum front yard of ten (10) feet in depth. If the unit is sited on an angle,
the front yard may average ten (10) feet but in no case shall the living unit be placed within five (5) feet of the front
lot line.

2.

Side. Four (4) feet.

3.

Rear. Each living unit shall have a minimum rear yard of five (5) feet in depth. If the unit is sited on an angle, the rear
yard may average five (5) feet, but in no case shall the living unit be placed within three (3) feet of the rear lot line.

U.

PARKING—Two (2) spaces in a carport or a garage shall be required on each living unit lot. In the case of a parallel
parking design each space shall be a minimum of ten (10) feet by twenty (20) feet. In the case of a tandem parking design
each space shall be a minimum of twelve (12) by twenty (20) feet.

V.

LIVING UNIT PLACEMENT
1.

Foundation. Each living unit shall be placed on the lot so that the unit rests at grade.

2.

Stabilizing System. A stabilizing system designed to increase the stability and seismic safety characteristics of the
unit shall be required. Said stabilizing system shall be approved by the Building Official prior to the siting of the
living unit.

3.

Permanent lot marking. The boundaries of each lot shall be clearly and permanently marked, so that each lot can be
readily determined at all times.

W.

ACCESSORY—BUILDINGS AND ACCESSORY STRUCTURES
1.

Design. The design of the living unit accessory structures shall be consistent with that of the living unit.

2.

Materials. The construction materials shall be the same as, or comparable to the exterior finishing materials of the
living unit.

3.

Commercial Use. No structure shall be erected or expanded for commercial purposes except those permitted by
the Conditional Use Permit.

4.

Administration or Recreation Building. Any such building shall be architecturally attractive and compatible with
living units, and shall be subject to approval of the Planning Commission.
